comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110615151330

Steps to reproduce:

In the "Confirm security exception" dialog box the wrong button is highlighted by default.


Actual results:

I previous versions of Firefox it was necessary to click "download certificate" to download the certificate,  now it's done automatically. Therefore, it's no longer necessary to have a"Download certificate" button, much less for it to be the default  selection.


Expected results:

Now that the certificate is downloaded automatically, the default selection should be  "Confirm security exception"
comments.text:
Created attachment 544574
Screen shot 2011-07-07 at 2.54.11 PM.png

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110615151330

Steps to reproduce:

In the "Confirm security exception" dialog box the wrong button is highlighted by default.


Actual results:

I previous versions of Firefox it was necessary to click "download certificate" to download the certificate,  now it's done automatically. Therefore, it's no longer necessary to have a"Download certificate" button, much less for it to be the default  selection.


Expected results:

Now that the certificate is downloaded automatically, the default selection should be  "Confirm security exception"
comments.author: andrew@joako.net
comments.creator: andrew@joako.net

comments.raw_text: This was reported under Firefox version 5.0. I have re-tested under Firefox 9.0.1 and the issue persists.
comments.creator: andrew@joako.net
comments.text: This was reported under Firefox version 5.0. I have re-tested under Firefox 9.0.1 and the issue persists.
comments.author: andrew@joako.net

comments.creator: a9016009@gmx.de
comments.raw_text:
Testing with 9.0.1 does not make sense as that is as unsupported as 5.0 is.
Please test with supported versions (currently: 13.0 and 10.0.4esr).

comments.raw_text:
Confirmed against
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:13.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/13.0 ID:20120601045813
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:16.0) Gecko/16.0 Firefox/16.0a1 ID:20120606030528

IMHO either the "View" (Certificate) or "Cancel" Button should be focused by default.

comments.creator: cykesiopka.bmo+mozbz@gmail.com
comments.text:
Thanks for filing the bug.

Note that to achieve the 'kill the "Get Certificate" Button part' requires fixing Bug 1035493, since the workflow there does require the button.
